title: Party on Fifth Ave.
text:
"Party on Fifth Ave." is a song by <a href="United%20States">American</a> <a href="hip%20hop">hip hop</a> artist <a href="Mac%20Miller">Mac Miller</a>, and the second single from his debut album "<a href="Blue%20Slide%20Park">Blue Slide Park</a>". The <a href="I.D.%20Labs">I.D. Labs</a>-produced track was released digitally on October 28, 2011 along with an accompanying music video.
Background.
"Party on Fifth Ave." is a hip hop song. It features a sample of the main loop from <a href="DJ%20Mark%20the%2045%20King">DJ Mark the 45 King</a>'s 1987 song "The 900 Number". The same loop was used by <a href="DJ%20Kool">DJ Kool</a> for his single "<a href="Let%20Me%20Clear%20My%20Throat">Let Me Clear My Throat</a>" in 1996. The original source of the loop is <a href="Marva%20Whitney">Marva Whitney</a>'s 1967 funky soul track "Unwind Yourself."
The song's music video features Mac Miller and his crew dressed as elderly men, complete with <a href="mobility%20scooter">mobility scooter</a>s and <a href="Assistive%20cane">canes</a>. The video was directed by Ian Wolfson.
Chart performance.
The song entered the <a href="Billboard%20Hot%20100">"Billboard" Hot 100</a> chart at #64 on November 10, as well as reaching #4 on the <a href="Top%20Heatseekers">Top Heatseekers</a> charts respectively.
